FuncDef: The display pim interface command displays information about PIM interfaces. The display pim interface command displays information about PIM interfaces.
CLIs: display pim interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> | up | down ] [ verbose ]
display pim { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> | up | down ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of an interface.
If this parameter is not specified, the command displays information about all PIM interfaces in a specified or all instances.

Specifies the number of an interface.
If this parameter is not specified, the command displays information about all PIM interfaces in a specified or all instances.

Displays information about PIM interfaces of which the IP protocol state is Up.
-

Displays information about PIM interfaces of which the IP protocol state is Down.
-

Displays detailed information about PIM interfaces.
-

Specifies a VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo: To check information about PIM interfaces (referring to those on which PIM is enabled), run the display pim interface command. The command output includes the number of PIM neighbor relationships that a PIM interface has established, interval at which Hello messages are sent, designated router (DR) priority, and DR address.
